programme.desc: Featured first-round bantamweight bouts: Leandro Higo vs. Josh Rettinghouse; Francesco Nuzzi vs. Mando Gutierrez; Kasum Kasumov vs. Justin Wetzell; featured flyweight bouts: Liz Carmouche vs. Ilara Joanne; Juliana Velasquez vs. Ekaterina Shakalova.

programme.title: Formula 1 Racing
programme.desc: F1 drivers aim for the best starting spot in the Bahrain Grand Prix, and the driver with the fastest time is awarded pole position; Max Verstappen finished with an 89.179-second lap time last year to win his second-straight pole at Bahrain.

programme.title: 30 for 30
programme.desc: The relationship between Bill Parcells and Bill Belichick is traced over four decades; Parcells and Belichick first worked together as assistants with the New York Giants and have forged a bond that few men of their stature have ever experienced.

programme.title: Formula 1 Racing
programme.desc: Analysts preview the Bahrain Grand Prix and four-time champion Max Verstappen, who comes off a win at Japan and won at Bahrain last year, going over the latest news from pit road and updated track conditions, along with their predictions on who wins.

programme.title: ESPN Films
programme.desc: The most remarkable sports stories are featured, as storytellers break away from the traditional view of a sports film and showcasing stories of passion, triumph, loss and resurgence of athletes, as featured guests share their side of the story.

programme.title: 30 for 30
programme.desc: The Lakers beat Philadelphia in the NBA Finals in 1980, 1982 and 1983, while Boston won the crown by beating Houston in 1981; Los Angeles and Boston staged the first of three epic battles in 1984, and the rivalry transformed fans' view of the game.

programme.title: 30 for 30
programme.desc: In 1978, the Celtics drafted Larry Bird, but he played his final year at Indiana State before signing; Los Angeles selected Magic Johnson No. 1 in 1979 after he led Michigan State to a victory over Bird and the Sycamores in the NCAA title game.

programme.title: 30 for 30
programme.desc: The Lakers and Celtics met in the NBA Finals for the first time in 1959, and in the 1960s the two franchises battled for the title six times; Bill Russell was a dominant figure for the Celtics, and Los Angeles featured Jerry West and Elgin Baylor.

programme.title: ESPN Films
programme.desc: The Los Angeles Dodgers and New York Yankees meet in the World Series in back-to-back years in 1977 and 1978, creating a cross-country rivalry featuring unique storylines throughout both dugouts and memorable moments in each series.

programme.title: Formula 1 Racing
programme.desc: Four-time defending champion Max Verstappen cut his deficit to Lando Norris to one point after winning at Japan; Verstappen averaged 201.582 kph last year en route to his second-straight win at Bahrain, beating Sergio Perez by 22.457 seconds.

programme.title: 30 for 30
programme.desc: In the summer of 1998, the St. Louis Cardinals' Mark McGwire and the Chicago Cubs' Sammy Sosa embarked on a chase of one of Major League Baseball's most hallowed records, igniting the passion and imagination of fans and non-fans everywhere.

programme.title: First Things First
programme.desc: Media personalities offer their views and opinions on the day's most intriguing storylines across the world of sports, including debates on the latest issues, analysis of player performances, and discussions on game results and other news.

programme.title: UFL Football
programme.desc: Defending champion Birmingham (0-1) dropped its opener to DC, 18-11, but won both meetings with the Panthers last season; Michigan (1-0) opened with a 26-12 win over Memphis behind a passing and rushing touchdown from Blake Perkins.

programme.desc: Former NASCAR driver and 2014 Cup Series champion Kevin Harvick and his friends break down the latest news making headlines across NASCAR, going over the latest results and interview guests to gather their unique perspective on the sport.

programme.desc: Former NASCAR driver and 2014 Cup Series champion Kevin Harvick and his friends break down the latest news making headlines across NASCAR, going over the latest results and interview guests to gather their unique perspective on the sport.

programme.title: PBA Bowling
programme.desc: The event pushes the world's top players to their physical limits as they race to throw as many strikes as possible in a two-minute window; 2024 champion Jesper Svensson, EJ Tackett, Jason Belmonte, Kris Prather and Ryan Barnes headline the field.

programme.title: Kevin Harvick's Happy Hour

programme.title: NASCAR Craftsman Truck Series
programme.desc: Daniel Hemric secured his first Truck Series win of his career with a victory at Martinsville over Tyler Ankrum; Christian Eckes averaged 80.017 mph en route to his win in the race at Bristol last year, beating Kyle Busch by 0.141 seconds.
